Subject: some practical issues in using atompub
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=408554521; y=D47W0a4L_oQGWqptRNiAfq2vI8D2lAwfrds-YuBNnaUped7mICgLnzNgHNrm

Hi all,

I've spent the last couple of months designing a system to support
data-sharing for a malaria research community, and much of this has
involved getting to grips with the atom publishing protocol as our
standard of choice for metadata persistence services. 

While this has worked well for the development of initial prototypes,
we're soon going to have to deal with a number of issues in moving to
a production system, and we'd really appreciate some help in making
the right decisions to move forward. I've written up some of these
issues at:

http://alimanfoo.wordpress.com/2009/12/15/rest-not-so-easy-data-sharing-networks-and-the-atom-publishing-protocol/

Ed Summers kindly pointed me at the rest-discuss list, and I see I
have a lot of catching up to do! In the mean time, any help or
suggestions of places to start would be extremely gratefully
received. We need to move fairly quickly, so pointers to working
solutions and existing open-source implementations would be especially
useful.

Many thanks,

Alistair

--
